snippet: The delay came as the government extended the detention of the ousted president, Mohamed Morsi, and appointed a judge to investigate him.
abstract: Egypt’s military-appointed government again postpones its threats to forcibly clear two camps of tens of thousands of supporters of Mohamed Morsi, country's ousted president; at same time, Egypt's government formally extends his detention at undisclosed location by 15 days and appoints judge to investigate him.
lead_paragraph: The delay came as the government extended the detention of the ousted president, Mohamed Morsi, and appointed a judge to investigate him.

headline.main: Egypt Delays Plans to Clear Morsi Backers From Camps
headline.print_headline: Egypt Delays Plans to Clear Morsi Backers From Camps

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
